channel.title: CVE Feed for cyberlord92 -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for cyberlord92 -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-4943|2024-08-03T01:55:46.044Z -- cyberlord92 -- miniorange%26%23039%3Bs%20google%20authenticator%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20two%20factor%20authentication%20%E2%80%93%202fa%20%2C%20two%20factor%2C%20otp%20sms%20and%20email%20%7C%20passwordless%20login
item.description: The miniOrange's Google Authenticator plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to authorization bypass due to a missing capability check when changing plugin settings in versions up to, and including, 5.6.5. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change the plugin's settings.

item.title: CVE-2024-2172|2024-08-01T19:03:39.304Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Malware Scanner plugin and the Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress (both by MiniOrange) are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the mo_wpns_init() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.2 (for Malware Scanner) and 2.1.1 (for Web Application Firewall). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator.

item.title: CVE-2024-2172|2024-06-24T14:45:20.223Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Malware Scanner plugin and the Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress (both by MiniOrange) are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the mo_wpns_init() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.2 (for Malware Scanner) and 2.1.1 (for Web Application Firewall). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator.

item.title: CVE-2024-2172|2024-03-13T15:26:53.433Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Malware Scanner plugin and the Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress (both by MiniOrange) are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the mo_wpns_init() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.2 (for Malware Scanner) and 2.1.1 (for Web Application Firewall). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator.

item.title: CVE-2024-0681|2024-03-13T15:27:08.355Z -- cyberlord92 -- page%20restriction%20wordpress%20%28wp%29%20%E2%80%93%20protect%20wp%20pages%2Fpost
item.description: The Page Restriction WordPress (WP) – Protect WP Pages/Post plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4. This is due to the plugin not properly restricting access to pages via the REST API when a page has been made private. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to view protected pages. The vendor has decided that they will not implement REST API protection on posts and pages and the restrictions will only apply to the front-end of the site. The vendors solution was to add notices throughout the dashboard and recommends installing the WordPress REST API Authentication plugin for REST API coverage.

item.title: CVE-2024-0681|2024-08-01T18:11:35.735Z -- cyberlord92 -- page%20restriction%20wordpress%20%28wp%29%20%E2%80%93%20protect%20wp%20pages%2Fpost
item.description: The Page Restriction WordPress (WP) – Protect WP Pages/Post plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to information disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4. This is due to the plugin not properly restricting access to pages via the REST API when a page has been made private. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to view protected pages. The vendor has decided that they will not implement REST API protection on posts and pages and the restrictions will only apply to the front-end of the site. The vendors solution was to add notices throughout the dashboard and recommends installing the WordPress REST API Authentication plugin for REST API coverage.
